Types
message_type

Core message type. Is used to collect the message, severity and other useful information around messages

Properties
id

Technical key

message_name

Name of the message

affected_id

Subject ID to which the message relates

error_code

Error code of the entry. May be used to divide several occurences of the same message name.

session_id

ID of the session as delivered by the adapter in use

schema_name

Name of the schema

module

Name of the package where the message was raised

action

Name of the package method the message was raised

user_name

Name of the user as delivered by the adapter in use

message_text

Tect of the message in the actually valid translation

message_description

Optional descriptive text, mostly used ot explain what to do in case of errors

severity

Severity of the message

stack

In case of error: Call stack

backtrace

in case of error: Error stack

error_number

Either an Oracle error code or one of the range -20999 .. -20000. Only applicable if level is error or fatal

message_args

List of arguments passed into the message.

Functions
format_icu
static function format_icu(
p_msg in varchar2,
p_params in varchar2,
p_locale in varchar2,
l_status out number,
l_error_message out varchar2
)
return varchar2

Method to format a message text using an external Java library and the standard ICU

Parameters
p_msg
in varchar2

Message text to format

p_params
in varchar2

Parameters to control the formatting

p_locale
in varchar2

Language settings

l_status
out number

Status message (0 = OK)

l_error_message
out varchar2

Error message if status is != 0

Returns

Formatted language according to the locale settings.

constructor function message_type(
self in out nocopy message_type,
p_message_name in varchar2,
p_message_language in varchar2,
p_affected_id in varchar2,
p_error_code in varchar2,
p_session_id in varchar2,
p_schema_name in varchar2,
p_user_name in varchar2,
p_msg_args msg_args
)
return self

Constructor function

Parameters
p_message_name
in varchar2

Name of the message

p_message_language
in varchar2

Language of the message

p_affected_id
in varchar2

Error code of the entry. May be used to divide several occurences of the same message name.

p_error_code
in varchar2

Error code of the entry. May be used to divide several occurences of the same message name.

p_session_id
in varchar2

ID of the session as delivered by the adapter in use

p_user_name
in varchar2

Name of the user as delivered by the adapter in use

p_msg_args
msg_args

List of arguments passed into the message.
